intro: Calophanes quitensis, commonly known as the Quitense Calophanes, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
